code:
// Mock data for the Government Policy Search Platform

export const mockPolicies = [{
  id: 1,
  title: "National Education Policy 2020 - Implementation Guidelines",
  date: "2024-01-15",
  source: "Ministry of Education",
  category: "Education",
  fullText: `The National Education Policy 2020 represents a comprehensive framework for transforming the education system in India. This policy aims to provide high-quality education to all students, from pre-school to higher education.

Key Features:
- Universal access to education for all children aged 3-18 years
- Multilingual education with mother tongue as medium of instruction
- Integration of technology in teaching and learning
- Focus on critical thinking and creativity
- Vocational education from Class 6 onwards
- Flexible curriculum with multiple entry and exit points
- Establishment of National Research Foundation
- Increased public investment in education to 6% of GDP

Implementation Timeline:
Phase 1 (2020-2022): Foundation and infrastructure development
Phase 2 (2022-2025): Curriculum and assessment reforms
Phase 3 (2025-2030): Full implementation and evaluation

The policy emphasizes equity, inclusion, and quality in education while preparing students for the challenges of the 21st century.`,
  summary: "Comprehensive education reform focusing on universal access, multilingual education, technology integration, and flexible curriculum with 6% GDP investment target.",
  keywords: ["education", "policy", "curriculum", "technology", "multilingual", "vocational", "research", "equity"]
}, {
  id: 2,
  title: "Digital India Scholarship Program for Rural Students",
  date: "2024-02-20",
  source: "Ministry of Electronics and IT",
  category: "Education",
  fullText: `The Digital India Scholarship Program aims to bridge the digital divide by providing financial assistance to meritorious students from rural areas pursuing technology-related courses.

Eligibility Criteria:
- Indian citizens from rural areas (population < 50,000)
- Annual family income below ₹3,00,000
- Admission to recognized technical institutions
- Minimum 75% marks in Class 12 or equivalent

Scholarship Benefits:
- Tuition fee waiver up to ₹50,000 per annum
- Monthly stipend of ₹5,000 for living expenses
- Laptop/tablet worth ₹30,000
- Internet connectivity support of ₹1,000 per month
- Mentorship program with industry experts

Application Process:
1. Online application through the official portal
2. Document verification at district level
3. Merit-based selection
4. Disbursement through Direct Benefit Transfer

The program targets 10,000 students annually and includes special provisions for girls and students from SC/ST communities.`,
  summary: "Financial assistance program for rural students pursuing technology courses, providing tuition waiver, stipend, devices, and mentorship support.",
  keywords: ["scholarship", "digital", "rural", "technology", "students", "financial assistance", "laptop", "mentorship"]
}, {
  id: 3,
  title: "Ayushman Bharat - Health Insurance Scheme Guidelines",
  date: "2024-03-10",
  source: "Ministry of Health and Family Welfare",
  category: "Healthcare",
  fullText: `Ayushman Bharat is the world's largest health insurance scheme, providing coverage of ₹5 lakh per family per year for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization.

Coverage Details:
- 10.74 crore families (approximately 50 crore beneficiaries)
- Cashless treatment at empaneled hospitals
- Coverage for 1,393 medical procedures
- Pre and post-hospitalization expenses
- Transportation allowance for emergency cases

Eligible Families:
- Families listed in SECC 2011 database
- Families with no adult member aged 16-59 years
- Families with no literate adult above 25 years
- Landless households deriving major income from manual labor
- SC/ST households
- Families with disabled member and no able-bodied adult

Hospital Network:
- Over 25,000 empaneled hospitals
- Mix of public and private healthcare providers
- Quality assurance through NABH accreditation
- Real-time monitoring and fraud detection

The scheme has processed over 4 crore hospital admissions since its launch, with a claim settlement ratio of 99.2%.`,
  summary: "World's largest health insurance scheme providing ₹5 lakh coverage per family for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization to 50 crore beneficiaries.",
  keywords: ["health insurance", "Ayushman Bharat", "healthcare", "hospitalization", "cashless", "SECC", "medical procedures"]
}, {
  id: 4,
  title: "Smart Cities Mission - Infrastructure Development Framework",
  date: "2024-01-30",
  source: "Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs",
  category: "Infrastructure",
  fullText: `The Smart Cities Mission aims to develop 100 cities across India with sustainable and inclusive development through the application of smart solutions.

Core Infrastructure Elements:
- Adequate water supply with 24x7 availability
- Assured electricity supply with smart metering
- Sanitation including solid waste management
- Efficient urban mobility and public transport
- Affordable housing for the poor
- Robust IT connectivity and digitalization
- Good governance with e-Governance and citizen participation
- Sustainable environment with green spaces
- Safety and security of citizens
- Health and education facilities

Implementation Strategy:
- Area-based development (retrofitting, redevelopment, greenfield)
- Pan-city development with smart solutions
- Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV) for project management
- Public-private partnership model
- Technology integration and innovation

Investment Details:
- Total project cost: ₹2,05,018 crore
- Central government share: ₹48,000 crore
- State/ULB share: ₹48,000 crore
- Convergence with other missions: ₹42,028 crore
- Private investment: ₹67,000 crore

The mission has completed 5,924 projects worth ₹1,10,000 crore as of December 2023.`,
  summary: "Development framework for 100 smart cities with sustainable infrastructure, digital solutions, and citizen-centric governance through area-based and pan-city development.",
  keywords: ["smart cities", "infrastructure", "urban development", "digitalization", "sustainability", "governance", "PPP", "technology"]
}, {
  id: 5,
  title: "Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN) Scheme",
  date: "2024-02-15",
  source: "Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare",
  category: "Agriculture",
  fullText: `PM-KISAN is a central sector scheme providing income support of ₹6,000 per year to all landholding farmer families in three equal installments of ₹2,000 each.

Beneficiary Criteria:
- Small and marginal farmer families with cultivable land
- All farmer families irrespective of size of landholding
- Exclusions: institutional landholders, serving/retired government employees, income tax payers

Payment Schedule:
- 1st Installment: April to July
- 2nd Installment: August to November  
- 3rd Installment: December to March

Implementation Mechanism:
- Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to bank accounts
- Aadhaar-based authentication
- State/UT governments responsible for beneficiary identification
- Real-time monitoring through PM-KISAN portal
- Grievance redressal system

Achievements:
- 11.8 crore farmers registered
- ₹2.81 lakh crore disbursed since launch
- 99.5% Aadhaar seeding completed
- Integration with e-NAM and other agricultural schemes

The scheme has significantly improved the economic condition of farmers and reduced their dependence on informal credit sources.`,
  summary: "Income support scheme providing ₹6,000 annually to landholding farmer families in three installments through Direct Benefit Transfer.",
  keywords: ["PM-KISAN", "farmers", "income support", "agriculture", "DBT", "landholding", "installments", "Aadhaar"]
}, {
  id: 6,
  title: "Startup India Initiative - Policy Framework and Incentives",
  date: "2024-03-05",
  source: "Ministry of Commerce and Industry",
  category: "Business",
  fullText: `The Startup India initiative aims to build a strong ecosystem for nurturing innovation and startups in India, driving sustainable economic growth and large-scale employment opportunities.

Key Policy Measures:
- Simplified compliance regime with self-certification
- Startup India Hub as single point of contact
- Legal support and fast-track patent examination
- Relaxed norms for public procurement
- Faster exit mechanism through Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code
- Tax exemptions for eligible startups

Financial Support:
- Fund of Funds for Startups (FFS) with corpus of ₹10,000 crore
- Credit guarantee fund for startups
- Tax holiday for 3 years in first 7 years
- Exemption from capital gains tax on investment
- 100% deduction on profits for 3 consecutive years

Recognition and Certification:
- Startup recognition certificate through online portal
- Intellectual Property Rights (IPR) benefits
- Fast-track patent application processing
- 80% rebate on patent filing fees
- Panel of facilitators for IPR services

Achievements:
- 1.17 lakh startups recognized
- 1,000+ startups funded through FFS
- 1,200+ patents filed with expedited processing
- 50+ incubators and accelerators established

The initiative has positioned India as the third-largest startup ecosystem globally.`,
  summary: "Comprehensive policy framework supporting startup ecosystem with simplified compliance, tax exemptions, funding support, and IPR benefits for innovation-driven enterprises.",
  keywords: ["startup", "innovation", "entrepreneurship", "funding", "tax exemption", "IPR", "compliance", "ecosystem"]
}, {
  id: 7,
  title: "Swachh Bharat Mission - Urban 2.0 Guidelines",
  date: "2024-01-25",
  source: "Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs",
  category: "Environment",
  fullText: `Swachh Bharat Mission - Urban 2.0 aims to make all cities 'Garbage Free' and ensure grey and black water management in all cities with less than 1 lakh population.

Mission Objectives:
- 100% waste processing in all statutory towns
- Source segregation of waste in all households
- Door-to-door collection in all wards
- Scientific processing of all types of waste
- Remediation of all legacy dumpsites
- Complete faecal sludge management
- Wastewater treatment and reuse

Key Components:
- Solid Waste Management (SWM)
- Information, Education and Communication (IEC)
- Capacity Building
- ODF+ and ODF++ sustainability
- Plastic Waste Management
- Biodegradable Waste Management
- Construction and Demolition Waste Management

Implementation Strategy:
- Convergence with AMRUT 2.0 and Smart Cities Mission
- Technology-driven solutions
- Public-private partnerships
- Community participation and behavior change
- Performance-based funding

Investment and Funding:
- Total outlay: ₹1,41,600 crore
- Central share: ₹36,465 crore
- State/ULB share: ₹18,232 crore
- Private investment: ₹87,000 crore

The mission has achieved 100% door-to-door collection in 4,372 cities and 100% waste processing in 1,200+ cities.`,
  summary: "Comprehensive waste management mission aiming for garbage-free cities with 100% waste processing, source segregation, and scientific disposal methods.",
  keywords: ["Swachh Bharat", "waste management", "garbage free", "segregation", "processing", "sanitation", "environment", "sustainability"]
}, {
  id: 8,
  title: "Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana - Micro Finance Scheme",
  date: "2024-02-28",
  source: "Ministry of Finance",
  category: "Finance",
  fullText: `Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana (PMMY) provides loans up to ₹10 lakh to non-corporate, non-farm small/micro enterprises for income-generating activities.

Loan Categories:
- Shishu: Loans up to ₹50,000
- Kishore: Loans from ₹50,001 to ₹5,00,000
- Tarun: Loans from ₹5,00,001 to ₹10,00,000

Eligible Borrowers:
- Small manufacturing units
- Shopkeepers, traders, service sector units
- Artisans, food processors, small industries
- Truck operators, taxi drivers, auto-rickshaw drivers
- Street vendors, small restaurant owners
- Small business activities and service sector units

Key Features:
- Collateral-free loans
- No processing charges
- Competitive interest rates
- Flexible repayment tenure
- Credit guarantee through CGTMSE
- Digital application and disbursement

Implementation:
- 200+ banks and financial institutions
- 1.5+ crore accounts opened
- ₹25+ lakh crore disbursed since launch
- 70% beneficiaries are women
- 50% beneficiaries are SC/ST/OBC

The scheme has empowered millions of entrepreneurs and created significant employment opportunities across various sectors.`,
  summary: "Micro finance scheme providing collateral-free loans up to ₹10 lakh to small and micro enterprises for income-generating activities with competitive rates.",
  keywords: ["Mudra", "micro finance", "loans", "entrepreneurs", "collateral-free", "small enterprises", "employment", "credit"]
}, {
  id: 9,
  title: "Digital Health Mission - National Health Stack Implementation",
  date: "2024-03-15",
  source: "Ministry of Health and Family Welfare",
  category: "Healthcare",
  fullText: `The Digital Health Mission aims to create a national digital health ecosystem that supports universal health coverage in an efficient, accessible, inclusive, affordable, timely and safe manner.

Core Components:
- Unique Digital Health ID (UHID) for every citizen
- Healthcare Professionals Registry (HPR)
- Health Facility Registry (HFR)
- Personal Health Records (PHR)
- Telemedicine and e-Pharmacy integration
- Health Analytics Platform

Key Features:
- Interoperable health data exchange
- Consent-based data sharing
- Privacy and security by design
- Real-time health monitoring
- AI-powered health insights
- Integration with existing health programs

Implementation Framework:
- Federated architecture with state-level implementation
- Open standards and APIs
- Public-private partnership model
- Capacity building and training programs
- Quality assurance and certification

Benefits:
- Improved healthcare delivery
- Reduced medical errors
- Better health outcomes
- Cost-effective healthcare
- Enhanced patient experience
- Data-driven policy making

The mission has registered 50+ crore citizens and 2+ lakh healthcare professionals across 33 states and UTs.`,
  summary: "National digital health ecosystem providing unique health IDs, interoperable data exchange, and AI-powered health insights for universal health coverage.",
  keywords: ["digital health", "health ID", "telemedicine", "health records", "interoperability", "AI", "healthcare", "privacy"]
}, {
  id: 10,
  title: "National Green Hydrogen Mission - Policy Framework",
  date: "2024-02-10",
  source: "Ministry of New and Renewable Energy",
  category: "Energy",
  fullText: `The National Green Hydrogen Mission aims to make India a global hub for production, usage and export of Green Hydrogen and its derivatives.

Mission Objectives:
- Development of green hydrogen production capacity of at least 5 MMT per annum
- Renewable energy capacity addition of about 125 GW
- Cumulative reduction in fossil fuel imports over ₹1 lakh crore
- Abatement of nearly 50 MMT of annual greenhouse gas emissions
- Creation of over 6 lakh jobs
- Development of domestic manufacturing capabilities

Strategic Interventions:
- SIGHT (Strategic Interventions for Green Hydrogen Transition)
- Pilot projects in identified sectors
- R&D and innovation ecosystem
- Skill development and capacity building
- Regulatory framework and standards

Target Sectors:
- Refining industry
- Fertilizer production
- Steel manufacturing
- Transportation sector
- Power generation and storage
- Industrial applications

Implementation Strategy:
- Public-private partnerships
- International collaboration
- Technology transfer and localization
- Infrastructure development
- Policy and regulatory support

Investment Plan:
- Total initial outlay: ₹19,744 crore
- SIGHT: ₹17,490 crore
- Pilot projects: ₹1,466 crore
- R&D: ₹400 crore
- Other components: ₹388 crore

The mission positions India as a leader in green hydrogen technology and contributes to global climate goals.`,
  summary: "Comprehensive mission to establish India as global green hydrogen hub with 5 MMT production capacity, 125 GW renewable energy, and significant emission reductions.",
  keywords: ["green hydrogen", "renewable energy", "clean energy", "emissions", "sustainability", "manufacturing", "R&D", "climate"]
}, {
  id: 11,
  title: "Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana - Urban Housing Scheme",
  date: "2024-01-20",
  source: "Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs",
  category: "Housing",
  fullText: `Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana - Urban (PMAY-U) aims to provide housing for all in urban areas by 2022, with a target of constructing 1.12 crore houses.

Mission Components:
- In-situ Slum Redevelopment (ISSR)
- Credit Linked Subsidy Scheme (CLSS)
- Affordable Housing in Partnership (AHP)
- Beneficiary Led Construction (BLC)
- Affordable Rental Housing Complexes (ARHCs)

Target Beneficiaries:
- Economically Weaker Section (EWS) - income up to ₹3 lakh
- Low Income Group (LIG) - income ₹3-6 lakh
- Middle Income Group (MIG-I) - income ₹6-12 lakh
- Middle Income Group (MIG-II) - income ₹12-18 lakh

Financial Assistance:
- Interest subsidy up to ₹2.67 lakh
- Central assistance of ₹1.5 lakh per house
- State/UT contribution of ₹1 lakh per house
- Beneficiary contribution of ₹1 lakh per house

Key Features:
- Women ownership or co-ownership mandatory
- Basic civic infrastructure provision
- Convergence with other urban missions
- Technology-driven implementation
- Transparent beneficiary selection

Achievements:
- 1.23 crore houses sanctioned
- 1.15 crore houses grounded
- 80+ lakh houses completed
- ₹8.31 lakh crore investment mobilized
- 4+ crore people benefitted

The mission has significantly improved the housing conditions of urban poor and middle-income families.`,
  summary: "Comprehensive urban housing scheme providing 1.12 crore houses with interest subsidies, central assistance, and mandatory women ownership for all income groups.",
  keywords: ["housing", "PMAY", "urban", "subsidy", "affordable", "women ownership", "infrastructure", "beneficiaries"]
}, {
  id: 12,
  title: "National Skill Development Mission - Implementation Guidelines",
  date: "2024-03-01",
  source: "Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship",
  category: "Education",
  fullText: `The National Skill Development Mission aims to create convergence across sectors and states in terms of skill training activities, including standardization of procedures and outcomes.

Mission Structure:
- National Skill Development Agency (NSDA)
- National Skill Development Corporation (NSDC)
- Directorate General of Training (DGT)
- Sector Skill Councils (SSCs)
- State Skill Development Missions (SSDMs)

Key Initiatives:
- Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana (PMKVY)
- Skill India Digital Platform
- Recognition of Prior Learning (RPL)
- Apprenticeship Training
- International Skill Development

Target Sectors:
- Agriculture and Allied
- Automotive and Auto Components
- Banking, Financial Services and Insurance
- Construction and Real Estate
- Electronics and IT
- Food Processing
- Healthcare
- Tourism and Hospitality
- Textiles and Apparel

Training Framework:
- National Skills Qualification Framework (NSQF)
- Industry-relevant curriculum
- Competency-based training
- Assessment and certification
- Placement assistance

Achievements:
- 1.3+ crore candidates trained
- 2,000+ training centers established
- 40+ Sector Skill Councils
- 10,000+ qualifications aligned to NSQF
- 70% placement rate achieved

The mission has created a robust skill ecosystem and improved employability of Indian youth.`,
  summary: "Comprehensive skill development framework with standardized training, industry-aligned curriculum, and placement assistance across 40+ sectors for youth employability.",
  keywords: ["skill development", "training", "employment", "NSQF", "PMKVY", "apprenticeship", "certification", "youth"]
}, {
  id: 13,
  title: "National Digital Literacy Mission - Digital India Initiative",
  date: "2024-02-05",
  source: "Ministry of Electronics and IT",
  category: "Technology",
  fullText: `The National Digital Literacy Mission aims to empower every citizen with access to digital resources, knowledge and information through digital literacy programs.

Mission Objectives:
- Digital literacy for 6 crore rural households
- Training of 1 crore citizens annually
- Establishment of Common Service Centers (CSCs)
- Digital infrastructure in rural areas
- E-governance services delivery

Training Components:
- Basic computer operations
- Internet usage and browsing
- Digital payment systems
- Government service access
- Cybersecurity awareness
- Mobile applications usage

Implementation Strategy:
- Village-level digital literacy centers
- Community-based training programs
- Women-focused digital literacy
- Senior citizen training programs
- School-based digital education

Key Programs:
- Pradhan Mantri Gramin Digital Saksharta Abhiyan (PMGDISHA)
- Digital Saksharta Abhiyan (DISHA)
- CSC Academy programs
- State-level digital literacy initiatives

Infrastructure Support:
- 4+ lakh Common Service Centers
- 2.5+ lakh Gram Panchayats connected
- High-speed internet connectivity
- Digital payment infrastructure
- E-governance platforms

Achievements:
- 5+ crore citizens trained
- 3+ lakh villages covered
- 1+ crore women digitally literate
- 50+ digital services available
- 99% Aadhaar enrollment completed

The mission has significantly reduced the digital divide and empowered citizens with digital skills.`,
  summary: "Comprehensive digital literacy program training 6 crore rural households in computer operations, internet usage, digital payments, and government services access.",
  keywords: ["digital literacy", "PMGDISHA", "CSC", "internet", "digital payments", "e-governance", "rural", "training"]
}, {
  id: 14,
  title: "National Clean Air Programme - Air Quality Management",
  date: "2024-01-12",
  source: "Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change",
  category: "Environment",
  fullText: `The National Clean Air Programme (NCAP) is a comprehensive strategy to tackle air pollution across the country with a target to reduce PM2.5 and PM10 concentrations by 20-30% by 2024.

Program Components:
- City-specific air quality management plans
- Source apportionment studies
- Air quality monitoring network expansion
- Technology interventions
- Public awareness and capacity building

Target Cities:
- 132 non-attainment cities identified
- 42 million-plus cities
- 90 cities with population 1-10 lakh
- Focus on Indo-Gangetic Plain region

Key Interventions:
- Industrial emission control
- Vehicular pollution reduction
- Dust management in construction
- Waste management improvements
- Green cover enhancement
- Clean fuel promotion

Implementation Framework:
- Central Pollution Control Board coordination
- State Pollution Control Boards implementation
- City-level action plans
- Real-time monitoring and reporting
- Performance-based funding

Technology Solutions:
- Continuous Ambient Air Quality Monitoring Stations (CAAQMS)
- Manual monitoring stations
- Mobile air quality monitoring
- Satellite-based monitoring
- Air quality forecasting

Investment and Funding:
- ₹4,400 crore allocated for 5 years
- 50% central funding for implementation
- Performance-based disbursement
- Private sector participation encouraged

The program has established 1,200+ monitoring stations and reduced PM2.5 levels by 15-20% in target cities.`,
  summary: "Comprehensive air quality management program targeting 132 cities to reduce PM2.5/PM10 by 20-30% through monitoring, technology interventions, and source control measures.",
  keywords: ["clean air", "pollution", "PM2.5", "air quality", "monitoring", "emissions", "NCAP", "environment"]
}, {
  id: 15,
  title: "One Nation One Ration Card - Food Security Initiative",
  date: "2024-03-20",
  source: "Ministry of Consumer Affairs, Food and Public Distribution",
  category: "Food Security",
  fullText: `One Nation One Ration Card (ONORC) enables migrant workers and their families to access their entitled foodgrains from any Fair Price Shop (FPS) across the country using their existing ration card.

Key Features:
- Inter-state portability of ration cards
- Aadhaar-based authentication
- Real-time transaction recording
- Biometric verification
- Transparent distribution system

Implementation Mechanism:
- Electronic Point of Sale (ePoS) devices at FPS
- Integrated Management of Public Distribution System (IM-PDS)
- Central Repository of Ration Cards
- State-level data integration
- Real-time monitoring dashboard

Benefits:
- Food security for migrant workers
- Elimination of duplicate ration cards
- Transparent and leak-proof distribution
- Reduced corruption in PDS
- Better targeting of beneficiaries

Coverage:
- 36 states and UTs implemented
- 5+ lakh Fair Price Shops covered
- 80+ crore beneficiaries enrolled
- 100+ crore transactions processed
- 99.5% Aadhaar seeding completed

Technology Infrastructure:
- ePoS devices with biometric authentication
- Online transaction recording
- Mobile applications for monitoring
- SMS alerts for transactions
- Grievance redressal system

The initiative has significantly improved food security for migrant populations and enhanced the efficiency of the public distribution system.`,
  summary: "Inter-state portability system enabling migrant workers to access foodgrains from any Fair Price Shop using Aadhaar-based authentication and biometric verification.",
  keywords: ["ration card", "food security", "migrant workers", "PDS", "Aadhaar", "biometric", "portability", "transparency"]
}];

export const chatResponses = {
  "who is eligible": ["Eligibility criteria vary by policy. Generally, Indian citizens meeting income thresholds, age requirements, and specific conditions outlined in each policy document are eligible.", "Most policies have specific eligibility criteria including income limits, residential requirements, and documentation needs. Please refer to the detailed policy document for exact requirements.", "Eligibility is typically based on factors like family income, age, educational qualifications, and residential status. Check the specific policy guidelines for detailed criteria."],
  "what are the benefits": ["Benefits include financial assistance, subsidies, access to services, and support programs as outlined in each policy. Specific benefits vary by policy type and target beneficiaries.", "Policy benefits typically include direct financial support, service access, infrastructure development, and capacity building initiatives tailored to the target population.", "Benefits range from monetary assistance to service delivery improvements, depending on the policy focus area. Each policy document contains detailed benefit descriptions."],
  "how do i apply": ["Applications can be submitted online through official portals, at designated centers, or through Common Service Centers. Ensure you have all required documents ready before starting the application process."],
  "when was this policy launched": ["Policy launch dates are mentioned in the document metadata.   "what is the budget": ["Budget allocations and funding details are specified in each policy document. This includes central government share, state contributions, and private sector investments.", "Financial provisions include total outlay, funding sources, and disbursement mechanisms. Budget information is detailed in the financial framework section of each policy.", "Budget details cover total investment, funding sources, and allocation mechanisms. Specific financial information is available in the policy's financial provisions section."]
};

// Categories for filtering
export const categories = ["All Categories", "Education", "Healthcare", "Infrastructure", "Agriculture", "Business", "Environment", "Finance", "Housing", "Energy", "Technology", "Food Security"];

// Sources/Ministries for filtering
export const sources = ["All Sources", "Ministry of Education", "Ministry of Health and Family Welfare", "Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs", "Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare", "Ministry of Commerce and Industry", "Ministry of Finance", "Ministry of New and Renewable Energy", "Ministry of Electronics and IT", "Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship", "Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change", "Ministry of Consumer Affairs, Food and Public Distribution"];

// Years for filtering
export const years = ["All Years", "2024", "2023", "2022", "2021", "2020"];

// Quick stats data
export const quickStats = {
  totalPolicies: 15,
  recentUpdates: 8,
  categories: 12,
  totalBeneficiaries: "500+ Crore"
};

sourcesContent:
// Mock data for the Government Policy Search Platform

export const mockPolicies = [
  {
    id: 1,
    title: "National Education Policy 2020 - Implementation Guidelines",
    date: "2024-01-15",
    source: "Ministry of Education",
    category: "Education",
    fullText: `The National Education Policy 2020 represents a comprehensive framework for transforming the education system in India. This policy aims to provide high-quality education to all students, from pre-school to higher education.

Key Features:
- Universal access to education for all children aged 3-18 years
- Multilingual education with mother tongue as medium of instruction
- Integration of technology in teaching and learning
- Focus on critical thinking and creativity
- Vocational education from Class 6 onwards
- Flexible curriculum with multiple entry and exit points
- Establishment of National Research Foundation
- Increased public investment in education to 6% of GDP

Implementation Timeline:
Phase 1 (2020-2022): Foundation and infrastructure development
Phase 2 (2022-2025): Curriculum and assessment reforms
Phase 3 (2025-2030): Full implementation and evaluation

The policy emphasizes equity, inclusion, and quality in education while preparing students for the challenges of the 21st century.`,
    summary: "Comprehensive education reform focusing on universal access, multilingual education, technology integration, and flexible curriculum with 6% GDP investment target.",
    keywords: ["education", "policy", "curriculum", "technology", "multilingual", "vocational", "research", "equity"]
  },
  {
    id: 2,
    title: "Digital India Scholarship Program for Rural Students",
    date: "2024-02-20",
    source: "Ministry of Electronics and IT",
    category: "Education",
    fullText: `The Digital India Scholarship Program aims to bridge the digital divide by providing financial assistance to meritorious students from rural areas pursuing technology-related courses.

Eligibility Criteria:
- Indian citizens from rural areas (population < 50,000)
- Annual family income below ₹3,00,000
- Admission to recognized technical institutions
- Minimum 75% marks in Class 12 or equivalent

Scholarship Benefits:
- Tuition fee waiver up to ₹50,000 per annum
- Monthly stipend of ₹5,000 for living expenses
- Laptop/tablet worth ₹30,000
- Internet connectivity support of ₹1,000 per month
- Mentorship program with industry experts

Application Process:
1. Online application through the official portal
2. Document verification at district level
3. Merit-based selection
4. Disbursement through Direct Benefit Transfer

The program targets 10,000 students annually and includes special provisions for girls and students from SC/ST communities.`,
    summary: "Financial assistance program for rural students pursuing technology courses, providing tuition waiver, stipend, devices, and mentorship support.",
    keywords: ["scholarship", "digital", "rural", "technology", "students", "financial assistance", "laptop", "mentorship"]
  },
  {
    id: 3,
    title: "Ayushman Bharat - Health Insurance Scheme Guidelines",
    date: "2024-03-10",
    source: "Ministry of Health and Family Welfare",
    category: "Healthcare",
    fullText: `Ayushman Bharat is the world's largest health insurance scheme, providing coverage of ₹5 lakh per family per year for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization.

Coverage Details:
- 10.74 crore families (approximately 50 crore beneficiaries)
- Cashless treatment at empaneled hospitals
- Coverage for 1,393 medical procedures
- Pre and post-hospitalization expenses
- Transportation allowance for emergency cases

Eligible Families:
- Families listed in SECC 2011 database
- Families with no adult member aged 16-59 years
- Families with no literate adult above 25 years
- Landless households deriving major income from manual labor
- SC/ST households
- Families with disabled member and no able-bodied adult

Hospital Network:
- Over 25,000 empaneled hospitals
- Mix of public and private healthcare providers
- Quality assurance through NABH accreditation
- Real-time monitoring and fraud detection

The scheme has processed over 4 crore hospital admissions since its launch, with a claim settlement ratio of 99.2%.`,
    summary: "World's largest health insurance scheme providing ₹5 lakh coverage per family for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization to 50 crore beneficiaries.",
    keywords: ["health insurance", "Ayushman Bharat", "healthcare", "hospitalization", "cashless", "SECC", "medical procedures"]
  },
  {
    id: 4,
    title: "Smart Cities Mission - Infrastructure Development Framework",
    date: "2024-01-30",
    source: "Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs",
    category: "Infrastructure",
    fullText: `The Smart Cities Mission aims to develop 100 cities across India with sustainable and inclusive development through the application of smart solutions.

Core Infrastructure Elements:
- Adequate water supply with 24x7 availability
- Assured electricity supply with smart metering
- Sanitation including solid waste management
- Efficient urban mobility and public transport
- Affordable housing for the poor
- Robust IT connectivity and digitalization
- Good governance with e-Governance and citizen participation
- Sustainable environment with green spaces
- Safety and security of citizens
- Health and education facilities

Implementation Strategy:
- Area-based development (retrofitting, redevelopment, greenfield)
- Pan-city development with smart solutions
- Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV) for project management
- Public-private partnership model
- Technology integration and innovation

Investment Details:
- Total project cost: ₹2,05,018 crore
- Central government share: ₹48,000 crore
- State/ULB share: ₹48,000 crore
- Convergence with other missions: ₹42,028 crore
- Private investment: ₹67,000 crore

The mission has completed 5,924 projects worth ₹1,10,000 crore as of December 2023.`,
    summary: "Development framework for 100 smart cities with sustainable infrastructure, digital solutions, and citizen-centric governance through area-based and pan-city development.",
    keywords: ["smart cities", "infrastructure", "urban development", "digitalization", "sustainability", "governance", "PPP", "technology"]
  },
  {
    id: 5,
    title: "Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM-KISAN) Scheme",
    date: "2024-02-15",
    source: "Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare",
    category: "Agriculture",
    fullText: `PM-KISAN is a central sector scheme providing income support of ₹6,000 per year to all landholding farmer families in three equal installments of ₹2,000 each.

Beneficiary Criteria:
- Small and marginal farmer families with cultivable land
- All farmer families irrespective of size of landholding
- Exclusions: institutional landholders, serving/retired government employees, income tax payers

Payment Schedule:
- 1st Installment: April to July
- 2nd Installment: August to November  
- 3rd Installment: December to March

Implementation Mechanism:
- Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to bank accounts
- Aadhaar-based authentication
- State/UT governments responsible for beneficiary identification
- Real-time monitoring through PM-KISAN portal
- Grievance redressal system

Achievements:
- 11.8 crore farmers registered
- ₹2.81 lakh crore disbursed since launch
- 99.5% Aadhaar seeding completed
- Integration with e-NAM and other agricultural schemes

The scheme has significantly improved the economic condition of farmers and reduced their dependence on informal credit sources.`,
    summary: "Income support scheme providing ₹6,000 annually to landholding farmer families in three installments through Direct Benefit Transfer.",
    keywords: ["PM-KISAN", "farmers", "income support", "agriculture", "DBT", "landholding", "installments", "Aadhaar"]
  },
  {
    id: 6,
    title: "Startup India Initiative - Policy Framework and Incentives",
    date: "2024-03-05",
    source: "Ministry of Commerce and Industry",
    category: "Business",
    fullText: `The Startup India initiative aims to build a strong ecosystem for nurturing innovation and startups in India, driving sustainable economic growth and large-scale employment opportunities.

Key Policy Measures:
- Simplified compliance regime with self-certification
- Startup India Hub as single point of contact
- Legal support and fast-track patent examination
- Relaxed norms for public procurement
- Faster exit mechanism through Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code
- Tax exemptions for eligible startups

Financial Support:
- Fund of Funds for Startups (FFS) with corpus of ₹10,000 crore
- Credit guarantee fund for startups
- Tax holiday for 3 years in first 7 years
- Exemption from capital gains tax on investment
- 100% deduction on profits for 3 consecutive years

Recognition and Certification:
- Startup recognition certificate through online portal
- Intellectual Property Rights (IPR) benefits
- Fast-track patent application processing
- 80% rebate on patent filing fees
- Panel of facilitators for IPR services

Achievements:
- 1.17 lakh startups recognized
- 1,000+ startups funded through FFS
- 1,200+ patents filed with expedited processing
- 50+ incubators and accelerators established

The initiative has positioned India as the third-largest startup ecosystem globally.`,
    summary: "Comprehensive policy framework supporting startup ecosystem with simplified compliance, tax exemptions, funding support, and IPR benefits for innovation-driven enterprises.",
    keywords: ["startup", "innovation", "entrepreneurship", "funding", "tax exemption", "IPR", "compliance", "ecosystem"]
  },
  {
    id: 7,
    title: "Swachh Bharat Mission - Urban 2.0 Guidelines",
    date: "2024-01-25",
    source: "Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs",
    category: "Environment",
    fullText: `Swachh Bharat Mission - Urban 2.0 aims to make all cities 'Garbage Free' and ensure grey and black water management in all cities with less than 1 lakh population.

Mission Objectives:
- 100% waste processing in all statutory towns
- Source segregation of waste in all households
- Door-to-door collection in all wards
- Scientific processing of all types of waste
- Remediation of all legacy dumpsites
- Complete faecal sludge management
- Wastewater treatment and reuse

Key Components:
- Solid Waste Management (SWM)
- Information, Education and Communication (IEC)
- Capacity Building
- ODF+ and ODF++ sustainability
- Plastic Waste Management
- Biodegradable Waste Management
- Construction and Demolition Waste Management

Implementation Strategy:
- Convergence with AMRUT 2.0 and Smart Cities Mission
- Technology-driven solutions
- Public-private partnerships
- Community participation and behavior change
- Performance-based funding

Investment and Funding:
- Total outlay: ₹1,41,600 crore
- Central share: ₹36,465 crore
- State/ULB share: ₹18,232 crore
- Private investment: ₹87,000 crore

The mission has achieved 100% door-to-door collection in 4,372 cities and 100% waste processing in 1,200+ cities.`,
    summary: "Comprehensive waste management mission aiming for garbage-free cities with 100% waste processing, source segregation, and scientific disposal methods.",
    keywords: ["Swachh Bharat", "waste management", "garbage free", "segregation", "processing", "sanitation", "environment", "sustainability"]
  },
  {
    id: 8,
    title: "Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana - Micro Finance Scheme",
    date: "2024-02-28",
    source: "Ministry of Finance",
    category: "Finance",
    fullText: `Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana (PMMY) provides loans up to ₹10 lakh to non-corporate, non-farm small/micro enterprises for income-generating activities.

Loan Categories:
- Shishu: Loans up to ₹50,000
- Kishore: Loans from ₹50,001 to ₹5,00,000
- Tarun: Loans from ₹5,00,001 to ₹10,00,000

Eligible Borrowers:
- Small manufacturing units
- Shopkeepers, traders, service sector units
- Artisans, food processors, small industries
- Truck operators, taxi drivers, auto-rickshaw drivers
- Street vendors, small restaurant owners
- Small business activities and service sector units

Key Features:
- Collateral-free loans
- No processing charges
- Competitive interest rates
- Flexible repayment tenure
- Credit guarantee through CGTMSE
- Digital application and disbursement

Implementation:
- 200+ banks and financial institutions
- 1.5+ crore accounts opened
- ₹25+ lakh crore disbursed since launch
- 70% beneficiaries are women
- 50% beneficiaries are SC/ST/OBC

The scheme has empowered millions of entrepreneurs and created significant employment opportunities across various sectors.`,
    summary: "Micro finance scheme providing collateral-free loans up to ₹10 lakh to small and micro enterprises for income-generating activities with competitive rates.",
    keywords: ["Mudra", "micro finance", "loans", "entrepreneurs", "collateral-free", "small enterprises", "employment", "credit"]
  },
  {
    id: 9,
    title: "Digital Health Mission - National Health Stack Implementation",
    date: "2024-03-15",
    source: "Ministry of Health and Family Welfare",
    category: "Healthcare",
    fullText: `The Digital Health Mission aims to create a national digital health ecosystem that supports universal health coverage in an efficient, accessible, inclusive, affordable, timely and safe manner.

Core Components:
- Unique Digital Health ID (UHID) for every citizen
- Healthcare Professionals Registry (HPR)
- Health Facility Registry (HFR)
- Personal Health Records (PHR)
- Telemedicine and e-Pharmacy integration
- Health Analytics Platform

Key Features:
- Interoperable health data exchange
- Consent-based data sharing
- Privacy and security by design
- Real-time health monitoring
- AI-powered health insights
- Integration with existing health programs

Implementation Framework:
- Federated architecture with state-level implementation
- Open standards and APIs
- Public-private partnership model
- Capacity building and training programs
- Quality assurance and certification

Benefits:
- Improved healthcare delivery
- Reduced medical errors
- Better health outcomes
- Cost-effective healthcare
- Enhanced patient experience
- Data-driven policy making

The mission has registered 50+ crore citizens and 2+ lakh healthcare professionals across 33 states and UTs.`,
    summary: "National digital health ecosystem providing unique health IDs, interoperable data exchange, and AI-powered health insights for universal health coverage.",
    keywords: ["digital health", "health ID", "telemedicine", "health records", "interoperability", "AI", "healthcare", "privacy"]
  },
  {
    id: 10,
    title: "National Green Hydrogen Mission - Policy Framework",
    date: "2024-02-10",
    source: "Ministry of New and Renewable Energy",
    category: "Energy",
    fullText: `The National Green Hydrogen Mission aims to make India a global hub for production, usage and export of Green Hydrogen and its derivatives.

Mission Objectives:
- Development of green hydrogen production capacity of at least 5 MMT per annum
- Renewable energy capacity addition of about 125 GW
- Cumulative reduction in fossil fuel imports over ₹1 lakh crore
- Abatement of nearly 50 MMT of annual greenhouse gas emissions
- Creation of over 6 lakh jobs
- Development of domestic manufacturing capabilities

Strategic Interventions:
- SIGHT (Strategic Interventions for Green Hydrogen Transition)
- Pilot projects in identified sectors
- R&D and innovation ecosystem
- Skill development and capacity building
- Regulatory framework and standards

Target Sectors:
- Refining industry
- Fertilizer production
- Steel manufacturing
- Transportation sector
- Power generation and storage
- Industrial applications

Implementation Strategy:
- Public-private partnerships
- International collaboration
- Technology transfer and localization
- Infrastructure development
- Policy and regulatory support

Investment Plan:
- Total initial outlay: ₹19,744 crore
- SIGHT: ₹17,490 crore
- Pilot projects: ₹1,466 crore
- R&D: ₹400 crore
- Other components: ₹388 crore

The mission positions India as a leader in green hydrogen technology and contributes to global climate goals.`,
    summary: "Comprehensive mission to establish India as global green hydrogen hub with 5 MMT production capacity, 125 GW renewable energy, and significant emission reductions.",
    keywords: ["green hydrogen", "renewable energy", "clean energy", "emissions", "sustainability", "manufacturing", "R&D", "climate"]
  },
  {
    id: 11,
    title: "Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana - Urban Housing Scheme",
    date: "2024-01-20",
    source: "Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs",
    category: "Housing",
    fullText: `Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana - Urban (PMAY-U) aims to provide housing for all in urban areas by 2022, with a target of constructing 1.12 crore houses.

Mission Components:
- In-situ Slum Redevelopment (ISSR)
- Credit Linked Subsidy Scheme (CLSS)
- Affordable Housing in Partnership (AHP)
- Beneficiary Led Construction (BLC)
- Affordable Rental Housing Complexes (ARHCs)

Target Beneficiaries:
- Economically Weaker Section (EWS) - income up to ₹3 lakh
- Low Income Group (LIG) - income ₹3-6 lakh
- Middle Income Group (MIG-I) - income ₹6-12 lakh
- Middle Income Group (MIG-II) - income ₹12-18 lakh

Financial Assistance:
- Interest subsidy up to ₹2.67 lakh
- Central assistance of ₹1.5 lakh per house
- State/UT contribution of ₹1 lakh per house
- Beneficiary contribution of ₹1 lakh per house

Key Features:
- Women ownership or co-ownership mandatory
- Basic civic infrastructure provision
- Convergence with other urban missions
- Technology-driven implementation
- Transparent beneficiary selection

Achievements:
- 1.23 crore houses sanctioned
- 1.15 crore houses grounded
- 80+ lakh houses completed
- ₹8.31 lakh crore investment mobilized
- 4+ crore people benefitted

The mission has significantly improved the housing conditions of urban poor and middle-income families.`,
    summary: "Comprehensive urban housing scheme providing 1.12 crore houses with interest subsidies, central assistance, and mandatory women ownership for all income groups.",
    keywords: ["housing", "PMAY", "urban", "subsidy", "affordable", "women ownership", "infrastructure", "beneficiaries"]
  },
  {
    id: 12,
    title: "National Skill Development Mission - Implementation Guidelines",
    date: "2024-03-01",
    source: "Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship",
    category: "Education",
    fullText: `The National Skill Development Mission aims to create convergence across sectors and states in terms of skill training activities, including standardization of procedures and outcomes.

Mission Structure:
- National Skill Development Agency (NSDA)
- National Skill Development Corporation (NSDC)
- Directorate General of Training (DGT)
- Sector Skill Councils (SSCs)
- State Skill Development Missions (SSDMs)

Key Initiatives:
- Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana (PMKVY)
- Skill India Digital Platform
- Recognition of Prior Learning (RPL)
- Apprenticeship Training
- International Skill Development

Target Sectors:
- Agriculture and Allied
- Automotive and Auto Components
- Banking, Financial Services and Insurance
- Construction and Real Estate
- Electronics and IT
- Food Processing
- Healthcare
- Tourism and Hospitality
- Textiles and Apparel

Training Framework:
- National Skills Qualification Framework (NSQF)
- Industry-relevant curriculum
- Competency-based training
- Assessment and certification
- Placement assistance

Achievements:
- 1.3+ crore candidates trained
- 2,000+ training centers established
- 40+ Sector Skill Councils
- 10,000+ qualifications aligned to NSQF
- 70% placement rate achieved

The mission has created a robust skill ecosystem and improved employability of Indian youth.`,
    summary: "Comprehensive skill development framework with standardized training, industry-aligned curriculum, and placement assistance across 40+ sectors for youth employability.",
    keywords: ["skill development", "training", "employment", "NSQF", "PMKVY", "apprenticeship", "certification", "youth"]
  },
  {
    id: 13,
    title: "National Digital Literacy Mission - Digital India Initiative",
    date: "2024-02-05",
    source: "Ministry of Electronics and IT",
    category: "Technology",
    fullText: `The National Digital Literacy Mission aims to empower every citizen with access to digital resources, knowledge and information through digital literacy programs.

Mission Objectives:
- Digital literacy for 6 crore rural households
- Training of 1 crore citizens annually
- Establishment of Common Service Centers (CSCs)
- Digital infrastructure in rural areas
- E-governance services delivery

Training Components:
- Basic computer operations
- Internet usage and browsing
- Digital payment systems
- Government service access
- Cybersecurity awareness
- Mobile applications usage

Implementation Strategy:
- Village-level digital literacy centers
- Community-based training programs
- Women-focused digital literacy
- Senior citizen training programs
- School-based digital education

Key Programs:
- Pradhan Mantri Gramin Digital Saksharta Abhiyan (PMGDISHA)
- Digital Saksharta Abhiyan (DISHA)
- CSC Academy programs
- State-level digital literacy initiatives

Infrastructure Support:
- 4+ lakh Common Service Centers
- 2.5+ lakh Gram Panchayats connected
- High-speed internet connectivity
- Digital payment infrastructure
- E-governance platforms

Achievements:
- 5+ crore citizens trained
- 3+ lakh villages covered
- 1+ crore women digitally literate
- 50+ digital services available
- 99% Aadhaar enrollment completed

The mission has significantly reduced the digital divide and empowered citizens with digital skills.`,
    summary: "Comprehensive digital literacy program training 6 crore rural households in computer operations, internet usage, digital payments, and government services access.",
    keywords: ["digital literacy", "PMGDISHA", "CSC", "internet", "digital payments", "e-governance", "rural", "training"]
  },
  {
    id: 14,
    title: "National Clean Air Programme - Air Quality Management",
    date: "2024-01-12",
    source: "Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change",
    category: "Environment",
    fullText: `The National Clean Air Programme (NCAP) is a comprehensive strategy to tackle air pollution across the country with a target to reduce PM2.5 and PM10 concentrations by 20-30% by 2024.

Program Components:
- City-specific air quality management plans
- Source apportionment studies
- Air quality monitoring network expansion
- Technology interventions
- Public awareness and capacity building

Target Cities:
- 132 non-attainment cities identified
- 42 million-plus cities
- 90 cities with population 1-10 lakh
- Focus on Indo-Gangetic Plain region

Key Interventions:
- Industrial emission control
- Vehicular pollution reduction
- Dust management in construction
- Waste management improvements
- Green cover enhancement
- Clean fuel promotion

Implementation Framework:
- Central Pollution Control Board coordination
- State Pollution Control Boards implementation
- City-level action plans
- Real-time monitoring and reporting
- Performance-based funding

Technology Solutions:
- Continuous Ambient Air Quality Monitoring Stations (CAAQMS)
- Manual monitoring stations
- Mobile air quality monitoring
- Satellite-based monitoring
- Air quality forecasting

Investment and Funding:
- ₹4,400 crore allocated for 5 years
- 50% central funding for implementation
- Performance-based disbursement
- Private sector participation encouraged

The program has established 1,200+ monitoring stations and reduced PM2.5 levels by 15-20% in target cities.`,
    summary: "Comprehensive air quality management program targeting 132 cities to reduce PM2.5/PM10 by 20-30% through monitoring, technology interventions, and source control measures.",
    keywords: ["clean air", "pollution", "PM2.5", "air quality", "monitoring", "emissions", "NCAP", "environment"]
  },
  {
    id: 15,
    title: "One Nation One Ration Card - Food Security Initiative",
    date: "2024-03-20",
    source: "Ministry of Consumer Affairs, Food and Public Distribution",
    category: "Food Security",
    fullText: `One Nation One Ration Card (ONORC) enables migrant workers and their families to access their entitled foodgrains from any Fair Price Shop (FPS) across the country using their existing ration card.

Key Features:
- Inter-state portability of ration cards
- Aadhaar-based authentication
- Real-time transaction recording
- Biometric verification
- Transparent distribution system

Implementation Mechanism:
- Electronic Point of Sale (ePoS) devices at FPS
- Integrated Management of Public Distribution System (IM-PDS)
- Central Repository of Ration Cards
- State-level data integration
- Real-time monitoring dashboard

Benefits:
- Food security for migrant workers
- Elimination of duplicate ration cards
- Transparent and leak-proof distribution
- Reduced corruption in PDS
- Better targeting of beneficiaries

Coverage:
- 36 states and UTs implemented
- 5+ lakh Fair Price Shops covered
- 80+ crore beneficiaries enrolled
- 100+ crore transactions processed
- 99.5% Aadhaar seeding completed

Technology Infrastructure:
- ePoS devices with biometric authentication
- Online transaction recording
- Mobile applications for monitoring
- SMS alerts for transactions
- Grievance redressal system

The initiative has significantly improved food security for migrant populations and enhanced the efficiency of the public distribution system.`,
    summary: "Inter-state portability system enabling migrant workers to access foodgrains from any Fair Price Shop using Aadhaar-based authentication and biometric verification.",
    keywords: ["ration card", "food security", "migrant workers", "PDS", "Aadhaar", "biometric", "portability", "transparency"]
  }
];
